Description: Rim sherd of Corinthian Silhouette Style pottery miniature kotyle (kotyliskos); interior: reserved band at lip, glazed (fired red) below; exterior: band of narrow vertical strokes at lip; below, narrow band (fired red) above wide band in added red; below, painted decoration, perhaps back of animal (dog?), with row of red dots as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Boardman and Hayes, Excavations at Tocra 1963-1965, the Archaic Deposits, BSA supplement no. 4, pl. 25-6, nos.356-394. For Hayes 1992, date of production c. 580-560 BC
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 204, no. N2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.314) (phase 3)
